author: Staff Reporter
text:
With the Assembly elections for the State having been announced by the Election Commission of India (ECI) on Friday, code of conduct came into force immediately, said Collector and District Election Officer Sajjansingh R. Chavan here on Friday.

Addressing heads of local bodies and officials at the Collectorate, Mr. Chavan apprised on the code of conduct to be enforced such as removal of party flags and banners in public places.

To advertise in private places, the parties must get permission from the owner of the property.

A round-the-clock election control room had been established at the Collectorate. Public could make election-related complaints on 04652 278212, 278215, 278218, 278219, 278010, he said.
title: Code of conduct comes into effect
